name: 102400, London #1
description:
Two people lay curled in sleeping bags underneath a brightly lit bridge, resting their heads on their suitcases. At least here they are protected from the elements, although it cannot be easy to sleep beneath such bright lights. A man walks past as if they are as much a part of the scenery as the bins behind them. 

The monochromatic, grainy nature of these shots lends a sense of anonymity to the subjects, people who are so often treated as invisible despite the fact that they are living in plain sight. By placing people experiencing homelessness as the central subject of this series, we are forced to confront the lived realities of homelessness and urban poverty as experienced around the world. 

102,400 represents the ISO or Film Speed that my camera is set to capture these images.
